Article Title: Tigress in 'boar' well: Prey and hunter's joint survival tale
Article Text: BHOPAL: Panchtantra met Jungle Book in the forests of Seoni , Madhya Pradesh, when a tigress chasing a boar fell into a well, along with the prey, in the heat of pursuit. Trapped in a battle for survival, both the hunter and hunted treaded the water together, often rubbing against each other in the closed confines.The two mostly faced away from each other. The tigress probably realised predation was pointless if it couldn't eat the kill. The boar, with nowhere to run, followed the predator's lead, even leaning on it when tired. Both were rescued by evening by forest officials with some jungle jugaad . Thereafter, each went its own way.Fittingly, this drama played out in the forest that was the setting for Kipling's 'Jungle Book'. Mowgli's Seoni is in Pench national park , around 400km from Bhopal. Villagers of Piparia Harduli, in Jikurai forest area, were in for a shock when they made their morning walk to the well to fetch water - a tigress and a boar were looking up at them. The tigress, exhausted from swimming, was visibly tired but remained calm. The boar would struggle from time to time just to stay afloat, trembling more from its proximity to the tigress than the cold water.Villagers alerted forest office. Kurai forest range assistant Shariq Khan got the call. A team from Pench tiger reserve, along with police, arrived on the scene and realised that there was no manual for such a rescue and they had to come up with some jugaad.The well was roped off to keep villagers well away from the scene of operation. Foresters worked out a system of ropes and tackles and used a JCB and a hydraulic crane to lower a cot and a cage into the well. The tigress lunged at it, and grabbed on to it, roaring, growling and refusing to let go. Foresters knew the cot would break under the tigress' weight and tried to push it away with a stick. The tigress snarled and roared and swiped at the stick, but it eventually got the message and went back into the water. When the cage was lowered, with its trapdoor open, the tigress attacked it. It took a while to understand that the metal beast wasn't going to swallow it and gingerly climbed into it, to cheers from the rescue team. The trapdoor fell shut.The boar, meanwhile, had realised that the cot was meant for it and climbed on to it. Both animals were pulled to safety. The boar was released back into the forest. The tigress, believed to be about three years old, will be released in Nauradehi sanctuary of Veerangana Durgavati tiger reserve in Sagar.
Article Summary: A tigress chasing a boar fell into a well, along with the prey, in the heat of pursuit. Both were rescued by evening by forest officials with some jungle jugaad. Fittingly, this drama played out in the forest that was the setting for Kipling's 'Jungle Book'

Article Title: Adam Hunter, former West Coast AFL premiership player, dies aged 43
Article Text:
Adam Hunter (Image credit: X)

Former West Coast Eagles player Adam Hunter , a key figure in their 2006 AFL premiership victory, has passed away at the age of 43. His body was found in Bunbury, south of Perth, early Wednesday.Hunter played 151 games for the Eagles during his decade-long AFL career from 2000 to 2009 before injuries forced him into early retirement.In 2006, he enjoyed his best goal-scoring season with 29 goals, including a crucial one in the dying moments of the grand final against Sydney. His celebratory gesture became an iconic moment in Eagles history as they avenged their loss to the Swans from the previous year.On Wednesday, West Coast paid tribute to Hunter on social media."We are devastated by the loss of 2006 Premiership Eagle Adam Hunter," the club posted on X. "Our thoughts are with his family, teammates, and friends."Hunter’s passing comes during a tough week for the AFL, following the deaths of former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood and Essendon VFL coach Dale Tapping on Tuesday.Troy Selwood's twin brother, Adam Selwood, was Hunter’s teammate at West Coast.After retiring from AFL, Hunter faced legal troubles and was fined $400 for cocaine possession after being stopped by Western Australian police in 2014.
Article Summary: Former West Coast Eagles player Adam Hunter has passed away at the age of 43. His body was found in Bunbury, south of Perth, early Wednesday. Hunter played 151 games for the Eagles during his decade-long AFL career. In 2006, he enjoyed his best goal-scoring season with 29 goals.

Article Title: “Hey media, the f*ck?”: Pat McAfee says Travis Kelce was too polite to the media regarding the refs favouring the Chiefs comments

Pat McAfee said he thought Travis Kelce was too polite to the media

Article Title: "Lit a fire in me": Eagles QB Jalen Hurts says losing to Chiefs in Super Bowl 57 motivated him like never before
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images

Jalen Hurts Says Eagles’ Super Bowl Loss to Chiefs 'Lit a Fire' in Him for Redemption



Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts is set to make his second Super Bowl appearance in just three seasons. The young quarterback came agonizingly close to glory in Super Bowl 57 , delivering an outstanding performance before falling short against the Kansas City Chiefs in a 38-35 thriller. Now, as he prepares to take center stage once again, Hurts is fueled by past heartbreak and determined to turn lessons into triumph.Jalen Hurts' journey back to the Super Bowl has been defined by resilience and an insatiable hunger for success. Reflecting on the Eagles’ loss to the Chiefs two years ago, he admitted that the experience has shaped him into a better player. Speaking during Super Bowl Opening Night, he shared how the painful defeat became a source of motivation:"I've learned so much. It's the same as any other game and, you know, I think the moments are the moments. But ultimately, you know, every game has its lessons -- good, bad or indifferent. So, just being able to become wiser, grow and mature and take all these lessons in for the next season and the next games. It's had a great driving force. It lit a flame, lit a fire in me, and to have this opportunity again is exactly what you work for."This fire has been evident throughout the season, as Hurts and the Eagles silenced critics and stormed back into championship contention. After a rough 2023 campaign, Philadelphia responded in dominant fashion, winning 14 regular-season games and setting a record for the most points in a conference title game with a commanding 55-23 victory over the Washington Commanders. The resurgence has been fueled by Hurts’ leadership and his relentless pursuit of excellence.Hurts has always been known for his level-headed approach, but the quarterback believes he has grown significantly since his last Super Bowl appearance. He acknowledged that experience and time have played key roles in shaping him both as a player and as a leader."Just the growth and the time. Every day there's a new lesson and a learning opportunity. I'm a more mature person and a better leader. All of these things, I've been able to push the threshold of [through] my entire career."His leadership will be crucial as he looks to overcome a formidable Kansas City defense that has allowed just 414 passing yards in two playoff games. The Eagles boast a talented roster around him, but ultimately, the weight of expectation rests heavily on Hurts’ shoulders. He understands that success isn't about silencing doubters but rather about trusting the work that has been put in."This is not about them, it's about the work you put in and everything [in a game] is a reflection of that work. I've always had a focus on myself and trying to improve, and ultimately beating whoever's in front of you."For Hurts, this opportunity is more than just another game—it’s a shot at cementing his place in NFL history. At 26, he has already proven his ability to perform on the biggest stage, but a Super Bowl win would elevate him into the league’s elite quarterbacks. As he put it himself, the chance to chase greatness is everything."It means everything. To have an opportunity to pursue whatever it is you're passionate about, whatever it is you love, it's very important."Also Read: Who will Tom Brady root for in the Super Bowl? The GOAT shares shares his insights ahead of the big game With the lessons of Super Bowl 57 still fresh in his mind, Hurts enters this championship clash with a renewed sense of purpose. The Eagles have done the work to return to this stage, and now, all eyes will be on their star quarterback to see if he can complete his redemption arc. For Hurts, the flame that was lit two years ago is still burning, and this time, he’s ready to finish the job.
Article Summary: Jalen Hurts says Eagles’ Super Bowl loss to Chiefs 'Lit a Fire' in him for Redemption. The young quarterback came agonizingly close to glory in Super Bowl 57 before falling short against the Kansas City Chiefs in a 38-35 thriller. Hurts believes he has grown significantly since his last Super Bowl appearance.

Article Title: "There’s definitely no conspiracy": Chiefs owner shuts down referee conspiracy theories, calls them mere 'excuses' for team’s dominance
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images

Chiefs Owner Claps Back at Referee Favoritism Accusations



The debate over NFL officiating has taken center stage ahead of the Kansas City Chiefs ' Super Bowl matchup against the Philadelphia Eagles. Once dismissed as baseless conspiracy talk, claims of the Chiefs receiving favorable calls have gained traction, dominating discussions during media week. With little actual football to analyze, the "rigged" narrative has become a talking point, despite lacking concrete evidence. Chiefs owner Clark Hunt firmly denied the speculation.With the Kansas City Chiefs on the verge of an unprecedented third consecutive Super Bowl victory, accusations of referee favoritism have emerged as a recurring narrative. However, Chiefs owner Clark Hunt has outright dismissed such theories, calling them nothing more than excuses from those unwilling to acknowledge the team’s well-earned success.Speaking to The Insiders on NFL Network, Hunt made it clear that any claims suggesting the league or officials have conspired to aid the Chiefs are baseless. “You almost have to laugh at it,” Hunt remarked, emphasizing that every team in the league is striving to win under fair competition. He further defended NFL referees, stating, “The referees are doing the best job they can. If you look at the stats, there are a lot of stats that show we've been on the wrong side of calls as often as we've been on the right side.”"There’s definitely no conspiracy, right? It’s the nature of the game. And when you start having a lot of success, people like to start making excuses for why you’re having the success."Hunt’s comments arrive amidst heightened scrutiny following the AFC Championship game , where the Chiefs' victory over the Buffalo Bills reignited debates over officiating. Two specific plays fueled the controversy—Josh Allen’s fourth-down QB sneak, where some fans questioned whether he had been stopped short, and Xavier Worthy’s contested reception against Bills safety Cole Bishop, which had critics claiming Bishop had a firm grip on the ball. These moments led many to cry foul, but Hunt insists that the Chiefs' success has nothing to do with officiating and everything to do with execution.The notion of a league-wide conspiracy in favor of the Chiefs has not only been dismissed by Hunt but also by those directly involved in officiating. Scott Green, the executive director of the NFL Referees Association, responded to these claims with strong words, highlighting the logistical absurdity of such accusations. “Officiating crews do not work the same team more than twice in regular season,” Green stated via Good Morning Football’s Peter Schrager. “It is insulting and preposterous to hear conspiracy theories that 17 officiating crews consisting of 138 officials are colluding to assist one team.”Green’s comments underline the randomness of officiating assignments, making it virtually impossible for any organized favoritism to take place. Yet, the narrative persists, largely fueled by the Chiefs’ ability to win close games and make clutch plays when it matters most. Over the years, the team has executed an extraordinary number of 50-50 plays, which has led some to mistakenly equate their success with officiating bias.While officiating controversies dominate headlines, the true reason behind the Chiefs’ sustained dominance lies in their quarterback, Patrick Mahomes. Time and again, Mahomes has delivered in high-pressure moments, elevating his team with remarkable poise and playmaking ability. With the Chiefs now one win away from a third straight Super Bowl title, Mahomes' postseason performances remain a major driving force.Hunt acknowledged the historic nature of this Super Bowl run, recognizing what’s at stake. “Any opportunity you have to play in the Super Bowl is always special. Obviously, this year has a little bit more to it because we have a chance to make history,” he said. He credited head coach Andy Reid for keeping the team focused and ensuring they approached each game with the same level of intensity. “Coach Reid has done a great job of keeping the guys focused because you don’t get here unless you pay attention each week, take that week's opponent as seriously as you can and play your best football.”Also Read: Will Taylor Swift's dad ditch Travis Kelce and support the Eagles during the Super Bowl LIX? The Chiefs’ TE gave a head-turning answer As the Chiefs prepare to face the Philadelphia Eagles in Super Bowl LIX on February 9, the scrutiny surrounding officiating is unlikely to subside. Every call—or non-call—will be dissected in real-time, adding to the tension of an already high-stakes showdown. Yet, as Hunt and the Chiefs have maintained, their success isn’t the result of external factors but rather their relentless commitment to excellence. Whether they cement their place in history with a third straight Super Bowl victory will ultimately come down to what happens on the field—not in the referee’s whistle.
Article Summary: Chiefs owner Clark Hunt dismisses claims of referee favoritism. Hunt: "There's definitely no conspiracy, right? It’s the nature of the game" Chiefs are one win away from a third straight Super Bowl title. Chiefs face Philadelphia Eagles in Super Bowl LIX on February 9.

Article Title: Who will Tom Brady root for in the Super Bowl? The GOAT shares shares his insights ahead of the big game
Article Text:
Image via Imagn Images

Tom Brady reveals whom he will be rooting for in the Chiefs-Eagles Super Bowl

Tom Brady thinks the Philadelphia Eagles have a good chance of winning Super Bowl LIX, but the Kansas City Chiefs are going for history. The Chiefs, with Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce at the helm, could be the first team to win three Super Bowls in a row after defeating the Eagles 38-35 in 2023. Although the Eagles lost to the Chiefs in 2023, Brady believes they can get revenge if Jalen Hurts continues his strong play under center.Tom Brady will call his first Super Bowl in New Orleans, making history if the Kansas City Chiefs win the three-peat. Brady, who missed the NFL's record two decades ago, may not want to see the Chiefs achieve what he could never do.Brady, who has no jealousy towards the AFC champs, having defeated Patrick Mahomes twice in the postseason, said he does not have a favorite team in the big game but is happy if the Chiefs win their third consecutive Lombardi Trophy.“Well, I’m broadcasting the game, so I don’t really have a rooting interest per se,” Brady said on the Let’s Go! podcast. “The only thing I root for in these situations are great games. I will say if the Chiefs win, I will be very happy for them. I mean, what they’ve achieved is unmatched.”Brady went on to describe similarities between his former team’s dynasty and that of the Chiefs. “I think that’s cool because people always hated on us for so many years. And I didn’t understand it because all I did was like, we try to do things the right way, we try to go out there and compete for our job and win,” continued Brady.He further added, “And there’s an excellence that I appreciate about people who are doing other things at really high levels because you understand the commitment that it takes for them to do what they’re doing. And to be in this country and to not cheer for excellence is beyond me.”Although the Eagles came up short against the Chiefs in 2023, Brady believes they can get revenge if Jalen Hurts continues his strong play under center. "The running game has been there all year. That's consistent," Brady said."AJ Brown getting open in man coverage or DeVonta Smith, that's consistent. Goddard is consistent. The line blocking well, that's consistent. When they can string a rhythmic passing game together, I think they're pretty unstoppable."Also Read: “He beat me a lot”: Tom Brady admits Aaron Donald was his toughest challenge as a quarterback he faced in Super Bowl Hurts has been a consistent performer for the Eagles this season despite not putting up huge numbers. He finished the year with 2,903 yards passing, 18 touchdowns and five interceptions. Tom Brady and Kevin Burkhardt will be in the Super Bowl booth on February 9th, watching the quarterback pass the torch to make NFL history, which is considered great cinema.

The Chiefs, with Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce at the helm, could be the first team to win three Super Bowls in a row. Brady, who missed the NFL's record two decades ago, may not want to see the Chiefs achieve what he could never do. Although the Eagles lost to the Chiefs in 2023, Brady believes they can get revenge if Jalen Hurts continues his strong play.

Article Title: “A Super Bowl ring?” Travis Kelce dodges Taylor Swift proposal question—Will the 2025 Super Bowl be the big moment?
Article Text:

Is Travis Kelce Planning a Super Bowl Proposal for Taylor Swift?



With the Super Bowl just days away, speculation is swirling not only about championship rings but also about a possible engagement ring. Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce , 35, added fuel to the fire when asked during the Super Bowl’s opening night in New Orleans on February 3 whether he planned to propose to Taylor Swift at the big game. Instead of shutting down the rumors, Kelce simply smiled coyly, keeping fans guessing.Travis Kelce found himself in the hot seat during Super Bowl LIX’s opening night in New Orleans, not just about football but about his high-profile relationship with Taylor Swift. With the global pop sensation expected to support him at the Caesars Superdome, the conversation naturally veered toward the possibility of an engagement.However, Kelce swiftly deflected any talk of popping the question. When asked directly whether he planned to give anyone a special ring, the Chiefs star quipped, “A Super Bowl ring? Next question.” Pressed again on the matter, he chuckled and responded, “Man, back-to-back, you guys are crazy. Wouldn’t you like to know?” The exchange, though brief, was enough to spark further speculation among fans.While he avoided discussing a potential proposal, Kelce had no problem speaking about Swift in other contexts. He praised her relentless work ethic and even gave a playful nod to her homemade pop tarts. “If she’s out here being the superstar she is, never taking no for an answer, and always working her tail off, I better match that energy for sure,” Kelce said. His words reflected the mutual admiration between the couple, who have been inseparable since going public with their relationship in 2023.Swift has become a frequent presence at Chiefs games, most recently seen cheering for Kelce during the AFC divisional-round victory against the Buffalo Bills. Her schedule, now free from the 2024 leg of her record-breaking Eras Tour, makes it highly likely she will be in the stands when the Chiefs face off against the Philadelphia Eagles on February 9.Beyond the football field, Swift has continued to make waves. Just a day before Super Bowl Media Day, she attended the 2025 Grammys in a striking Chiefs-red dress adorned with a subtle “T” charm. Although she left the ceremony without a win from her six nominations, she still managed to steal the spotlight with viral moments, including snagging Janelle Monáe’s jacket and sharing a dance with Alicia Keys' son Genesis.Also Read: Travis Kelce Shuts Down the Media After Having Enough of Referee Questions! As anticipation builds for the Super Bowl, fans remain eager to see whether Kelce will take a step beyond victory celebrations and into engagement territory. While it may be a stretch to expect a You Belong With Me-style romantic gesture, some Swifties are holding out hope. For now, Kelce remains laser-focused on securing his third Super Bowl ring—any talk of another type of ring will have to wait.
Article Summary: Travis Kelce was asked whether he planned to propose to Taylor Swift at the Super Bowl. Kelce smiled coyly, keeping fans guessing. The couple have been inseparable since going public with their relationship in 2023. Swift has become a frequent presence at Chiefs games.

Article Title: Was Travis Kelce arrested on drug charges? The Chiefs' TE talks about the chapter in his past that nearly ended his football career before it even began
Article Text:
Image via AP

Travis Kelce opens up about the drug scandal

Chiefs TE Travis Kelce speaks at Super Bowl LIX opening night

It was rampant with rumors within the NFL world about Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce being arrested on drug charges, but on closer examination, those rumors disproved since there is no factual basis to support them. The phrase Travis Kelce Arrested on Drug Charges began trending across various social media platforms, and fans and critics began speculating about its validity. Some posts said that the NFL star was caught in possession of large quantities of marijuana, while others said he was detained in Las Vegas after a drug-related altercation.Travis Kelce has a dark chapter in his history that almost ended his football career before it could even start. Kelce spoke about the 2010 NCAA drug scandal that ended up suspending him from the University of Cincinnati football team as he appeared during Super Bowl Opening Night in New Orleans. Kelce, having earned a spot on the roster and changing his life, made an impact with his family by showing himself to be willing to confront his past mistakes."I think it was a very emotional and meaningful thing that happened to me back in college, and I brought that all on myself," Kelce admitted. "I think it was just me not living up to my family's expectations, and that was probably the biggest thing. Bringing negativity to them was probably the hardest part for me.”In 2010, Kelce was suspended for failing a marijuana drug test in New Orleans before the Sugar Bowl, causing uncertainty for his future in football, despite being considered a promising young talent for the Cincinnati Bearcats. Kelce, who shared his experience as a wake-up call on the Bussin' With the Boys podcast in 2023, has been transparent about the occurrence."I partied a little too much down there [New Orleans], got hit with a drug test, and from that point on, I realized I've got to tighten the f** up," he said. Kelce interviewed his former college roommate, Zach Collaros, who shared a humorous and touching story about a specific period in his life. "My mom visited one time when Travis was suspended. She doesn't like going to games, so she just stayed behind and cleaned the house," Collaros recalled.He added, "She smelled something and walked downstairs in the basement, and it's Trav-smoking a joint. She goes, 'Travis, aren't you suspended for this?!?' And he just says, 'Hey Momma Collaros, it's all right. When are we going to the game?' And they walked to the game together.”Kelce later confirmed the story on his New Heights podcast, laughing about how wild those days were. "I made sure to tell them, don't hold back-tell all the good stories. And sure enough, they mentioned all the really good ones, like Zach's mom walking in on me firing up in the garage before one of the games. Absolutely hilarious. That's how I was living back then," he noted.Also Read: “Find a way to get into another career”: Travis Kelce opens up on where he plans to be in three years
Article Summary: Travis Kelce was suspended from the University of Cincinnati football team in 2010 for failing a marijuana drug test. The Kansas City Chiefs star has been transparent about the occurrence. Kelce spoke about the incident as he appeared at Super Bowl Opening Night in New Orleans.

Article Title: “He beat me a lot”: Tom Brady admits Aaron Donald was his toughest challenge as a quarterback he faced in Super Bowl
Article Text:
Image via AP

Aaron Donald continues to give Tom Brady nightmares

Tom Brady on Super Bowl prep, Beating the Chiefs, Bill Belichick compliments | NFL | THE HERD

Before he calls his first Super Bowl next week for FOX , Tom Brady talked about his experiences playing in the big game and named Los Angeles Rams defensive tackle Aaron Donald as the toughest defender he faced in a Super Bowl. In Brady's final Super Bowl, the New England Patriots defeated Donald and the Rams, despite a 13-point win, making it the lowest-scoring Super Bowl in history, focusing on controlling Donald's impact and controlling his offensive game plan.Tom Brady may go down in the record books as the greatest ever quarterback, but Aaron Donald continues to give Brady nightmares about some of his otherworldly techniques. Former quarterback of the New England Patriots who now comments on Fox Sports came on FS1's The Herd with Colin Cowherd, and, in anticipation of calling his very first Super Bowl next week."There's one guy late in my career who I went against who every time we played him he was an absolute nuisance," Brady said of Donald. "I didn't get him very often, in fact he got me a lot. He beat me a lot, but in the Super Bowl in 2018 against the Rams, we faced Aaron Donald. We actually limited his ability to make a lot of plays in that game because we had a lot of double teams.”Brady continued, "Every single play, run, pass, including pass protection, was designed to keep him out of the backfield and keep him from making negative plays. Now, he didn't make many negative plays, and at the same time, we only scored 13 points in the game.”He further added, “It was one of the hardest games and biggest challenges I ever faced because he forced us to do so many things that we didn't necessarily want to do from a game plan standpoint. Even though we limited his ability to impact the game on the stat sheet, it affected our ability to score points. Thank God our defense played so great or we wouldn't have won the game.”Super Bowl LIII was the lowest-scoring Super Bowl ever, with the Patriots scoring just 13 points against Wade Phillips' defense. The defensive mastermind of Bill Belichick held the Rams offense to just three points, securing their sixth Lombardi Trophy, even though the Patriots struggled against Wade Phillips' defense.Also Read: Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen achieved something even the GOAT Tom Brady never accomplished Donald did not have a sack or tackle for loss against New England but confessed to "hating" Brady for three years after the Patriots' victory, having gone on to win the Super Bowl with the Rams in 2021-22.
Article Summary: Tom Brady says Aaron Donald is the toughest defender he faced in a Super Bowl. The New England Patriots defeated Donald and the Rams, despite a 13-point win. Donald did not have a sack or tackle for loss against New England but confessed to "hating" Brady for three years.

Article Title: Mason Crosby Retirement: Mason Crosby Says Goodbye to the NFL! Packers’ All-Time Leading Scorer Retires After Historic Career
Article Text:
(Doug Murray / Associated Press)

Mason Crosby Retires: Legendary Kicker Reflects on 17 Seasons and an Unforgettable Packers Legacy



"My 17 seasons in the NFL surpassed all of my childhood hopes and dreams. I couldn't be more grateful that 16 of those years were spent with the Packers. Being drafted in the 6th round of the 2007 draft, I could have never written the script of what my career was going to become."

A Glance Through His Legendary NFL Career and Lifelong Impression







The Packers' all-time leading scorer, Mason Crosby, officially put away his cleats after a historic 17-year career with the NFL. Article Title: “It's all about the game”: Eagles enter Super Bowl 2025 with focused mindset, aiming for victory over Chiefs
Article Text:

The Eagles' attitude this time is significantly different from their previous Super Bowl performance

The Eagles are entering Super Bowl 2025 with a focused, business-like mindset. The team emphasized that their goal is to win, not to have fun. The team is determined to overcome the Chiefs, whom they’ve struggled against in recent years, including a loss in the 2023 season.The Eagles’ mindset this time is a sharp contrast to their previous Super Bowl appearance. After their loss to the Chiefs, they are coming in with a determined, business-first attitude, focused on securing the win. The Chiefs, on the other hand, have already established themselves as a dynasty, with a calm, experienced approach to the Super Bowl that has helped them succeed repeatedly.While the Eagles are treating the game more seriously this time, they hope their changed mentality will lead to a different, more successful result.The Eagles didn't blame lack of focus two years ago, but the Super Bowl distractions can be overwhelming. This time, they seem more prepared to stay focused and avoid getting sidetracked. "All of this media stuff is cool, but none of this matters," A.J Brown said. "It's all about the game.”“Focusing on us and kind of blocking you guys the media out, that's kind of been the focus all year," Mailata said. "Making sure, as repetitive as it sounds, keeping the main thing the main thing."In Super Bowl LVII, the Eagles gave the Chiefs a tough fight, with Jalen Hurts delivering one of his best performances. He led the Eagles to a tie with just over five minutes remaining. However, Patrick Mahomes showcased his clutch ability, leading the Chiefs on a long drive in the final minutes, setting up the game-winning score. Mahomes’ performance in crucial moments made the difference, securing the victory for Kansas City."You can't really spend your time looking on the past. If you look behind you, you'll never go forward," defensive tackle Jordan Davis said. "But obviously you want to learn from your mistakes."We have another opportunity in front of our faces to rewrite a story that we have.""As you go through any game in the NFL that you play, any game really that I've been coaching as you play, you think about the things that you did well, then you think about the things that you didn't do well and how you can improve on those things," Eagles head coach Nick Sirianni said."That was something that we went through when we got back from the Super Bowl. Hey, here's what we did well, here's what we didn't do well, and you try to get better from those things. I won't get into the things that were changed through the daily organization of a Super Bowl week, but there's some things that we're doing a little bit different to try to get better from our last experience."The Eagles’ Opening Night for the Super Bowl, like every other team before them, was filled with spectacle and fun moments. The players laughed at bizarre questions about Kendrick Lamar and quirky locker room habits. However, amidst the lightheartedness, they emphasized a more serious focus: this time, they’re determined to stay locked in on their goal of winning the Super Bowl.The reminder served not only for the media but perhaps as a mental checkpoint for the team itself, signaling their concentration on what’s ahead. "It's being in the moment, being where your feet are at," Mailata said. "Making sure we're not making the moment bigger than it is."Also Read: “That's a ridiculous theory”: Rodger Goodell thrashed the theories of the Chiefs being favoured by the refs Despite the loss, Hurts' performance in the Super Bowl solidified his status as one of the top quarterbacks in the league, but Mahomes' clutch play and big-game experience once again proved why he's one of the best to ever do it.

Devin Booker made history Monday night, becoming the Phoenix Suns ’ all-time leading scorer during their game against the Portland Trail Blazers. Booker's commitment to one franchise, much like Bryant’s with the Lakers, stood out in an era of constant player movement. “That’s something he always said. He always wanted to stay here. Kobe had a big influence on him. Kobe played with one franchise. I hope we can pull that off and do the same thing here,” Melvin shared.Melvin further shared that his son, Booker is following the the footsteps of the late NBA legend who has spent the entire twenty years of his career with the Los Angeles Lakers. Booker is also expected to do the same, at least, according to his father.It’s no easy feat to achieve and Booker knows that but he has spent 10 years of his career with the Suns. Reflecting on his record-breaking achievement, he let his feelings known during the post-game interview. "It means everything," Booker said. "Just being drafted to a franchise that believed in me, taking a chance on me as an 18-year-old kid and going through a rebuild phase and just sticking with it. Keeping my head down. The love and support has always been there. I don't take it from granted,” he added.Like his father’s statement, Booker also asserted his loyalty to the Suns adding “I take it seriously putting 'Phoenix' across my chest."Suns head coach Mike Budenholzer has also responded to Booker’s record. “What a great accomplishment for a great player, for a great human. With multiple All-NBA selections and four All-Star appearances, he’s long been one of the league’s top scorers.

Article Title: Former UK PM Rishi Sunak plays cricket in Mumbai, 'Managed not to get out too many times'

Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Sunday visited the Parsee Gymkhana in south Mumbai and enjoyed a game of cricket, asserting he was happy that he did not get out too many times.

He hinted at more such visits in the future, saying he looked forward to coming back.

NEW DELHI: As India prepare to get into ODI mode with a series against England ahead of the all-important Champions Trophy later this month, captain Rohit Sharma has been asked to communicate his "future plans" to the BCCI and selectors after the completion of the ICC event.TOI has learnt that the selectors are eager to set plans in motion for the 2027 ODI World Cup and start a transition process for Test cricket as well. They are keen to find a stable captaincy option in both formats. As for Virat Kohli , the selectors are willing to wait a bit more on his Test form, while his ODI prowess is not seen as a major problem.Opener Rohit turns 38 in April and will be almost 40 by the time the next ODI World Cup in South Africa comes around. Article Title: SA20: MI Cape Town continue their rampaging run to book spot in the final
Article Text:
Photo Credit: @MICapeTown on X

TimesofIndia.com from Gqeberha:

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

MI Cape Town continued their rampant run in the SA20 when they beat Paarl Royals by 39 runs in the first qualifier on Tuesday. With their comfortable win at St George's Park in Gqeberha, MI Cape Town booked their place in the final at the Wanderers in Johannesburg on Saturday. Paarl Royals, meanwhile, will have another bite at the cherry when they take on the victor of the Eliminator between Joburg Super Kings and Sunrisers Eastern Cape.MI Cape Town will enter the final with momentum on their side, picking their fifth win in a row and extended their unbeaten streak seven. The last time they tasted defeat was against the Paarl Royals on January 15.Royals, on the other hand, are headed in the other direction as they succumbed to their third loss in a row, having waltzed into the playoffs courtesy a flawless home record - just like MICT.On Tuesday at St George's Park, the Royals never looked like bothering MICT. Even when three of MI Cape Town's wickets fell in the gap of six runs and eight balls. Or when David Miller and Dunith Wellalage built a 33-run stand and then Miller took the onus alongside Dinesh Karthik.The PR captain Miller slammed three boundaries in the ninth Corbin Bosch over. He then went big on two consecutive balls for back-to-back sixes in the 14th over. Despite this big hitting, the Royals never really looked like getting close to MI Cape Town's 200-run target.The game was put beyond the Royals' reach in the very first innings itself. St George's Park had seen an average total of 129 this season with the highest coming from the bat of MI Cape Town batters (174/7) at the start of the season.After the Royals won the toss and decided to field, they were put under the pump from the get go. Ryan Rickelton (44 from 27 balls) and Rassie van der Dussen (40 from 32 balls) continued their exploits this SA20 season. They quickly made their mark and raced off to 73/0 after the powerplay overs. Both the MICT batters dealt in boundaries with seven fours and four sixes between them.Just when Paarl Royals appeared to have applied the brakes with three quick wickets, up stepped George Linde (26 from 14 balls) to shift the flow of the game.MICT ended with a flourish, producing 74 runs from the last five overs - 15, 6, 9, 27, 17 respectively - to put the eventual outcome beyond any doubt. At the heart of the late flurry were Dewald Brevis (44* from 30 balls) and Delano Potgieter (32* from 17 balls).
Article Summary: MI Cape Town beat Paarl Royals by 39 runs in the first qualifier of the SA20 tournament. With their comfortable win, MI Cape Town booked their place in the final at the Wanderers in Johannesburg on Saturday. David Miller hit three boundaries in the ninth Corbin Bosch over and back-to-back sixes in the 14th.
